text: Gilles Veissière (born September 18, 1959 in Nice) is a football referee from France, best known for supervising two matches during the 2002 FIFA World Cup in South Korea and Japan.FIFA. "Match Report - Argentina - Nigeria 1:0 (0:0)". June 2, 2002. Retrieved on May 27, 2013.FIFA. "Match Report - Tunisia - Japan 0:2 (0:0)". June 14, 2002. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. He also led two matches at the 2000Winkler, Pierre. "European Championship 2000 - Full Details Final Tournament". RSSSF, January 17, 2004. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. and 2004 UEFA European Football Championship,Courtney, Barrie; Haisma, Marcel; Saaid, Hamdan. "European Championship 2004 - Details". RSSSF, February 21, 2007. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. and has refereed numerous UEFA Champions League matches. He was selected for the FIFA Europe vs. Rest of the World match to accompany the World Cup draw in Marseille in 1997.Morrison, Neil. "International Matches 1997 - Other". RSSSF, February 2, 2005. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. Veissière is known to have served as a FIFA referee during the period from 1994Miladinovich, Misha. "Croatia - International Matches 1990-1995" . RSSSF, December 13, 1999. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. to 2004. He also officiated in numerous other international competitions, including the 1997 FIFA World Youth Championship,FIFA. "Veissiere to referee opening match". June 15, 1997. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. qualifying matches for the 1998,FIFA. "Match Report - Greece - Denmark 0:0". October 11, 1997. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. 2002,FIFA. "Match Report - Croatia - Scotland 1:1 (1:1)". October 11, 2000. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. and 2006FIFA. "Match Report - Bosnia-Herzegovina - Serbia and Montenegro 0:0". October 9, 2004. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. World Cups, and qualifying matches for Euro 1996,UEFA. "Czech Republic 4-2 Belarus". March 29, 1995. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. Euro 2000,UEFA. "Spain 9-0 Austria". March 27, 1999. Retrieved on May 27, 2013. and Euro 2004.UEFA. "Croatia 1-0 Bulgaria". October 11, 2003.
